Plot: A young Pakistani man is chasing corporate success on Wall Street. He finds himself embroiled in a conflict between his American Dream, a hostage crisis, and the enduring call of his family's homeland.
Title: The Reluctant Fundamentalist
Writer: Javed Akhtar (eulogy in urdu), Ami Boghani (screen story), Mohsin Hamid (novel), Mohsin Hamid (screen story), William Wheeler (screenplay)
Actors: Riz Ahmed, Kate Hudson, Liev Schreiber, Kiefer Sutherland
tomatoConsensus: The Reluctant Fundamentalist is technically proficient, with solid acting and cinematography, but its message is so ambitious and heavy-handed that some of its power is robbed.
